instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no dfu
threads.message: Hello I have this machine stopped on the 5v 0.09A on the usb ports on the right and 20v 0.02A on the usb ports on the left, Also the voltages wrong at <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> are unstable or they are in loop between 0V and the nominal value PPBUS 12.57

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no dfu
threads.message:
You have some problem on the left USB-C area.

Do you get stable 20V on right side, even with <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>'s fluctuating voltages?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no dfu
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power no dfu
threads.message: Compare diode mode readings between left/right channels...
